query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «S’io ti fiammeggio nel caldo d’amore 2 di là dal modo che ’n terra si vede, 3 sì che del viso tuo vinco il valore,
query.error: **English:** 1 “If I inflame you with the warmth of love 2 beyond the way that is seen on earth, 3 so that I overcome the power of your sight,
query.result: 1 “Mar karys vy dhe flammya gans tommos karantek 2 a-ves dhe’n fordh a wellir war an nor, 3 pubma ow kovlaf nerth aga golwg,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 non ti maravigliar, ché ciò procede 5 da perfetto veder, che, come apprende, 6 così nel bene appreso move il piede.
query.error: **English:** 4 do not be amazed, for this proceeds 5 from perfect seeing, which, as it apprehends, 6 so moves the foot in the good that is apprehended.
query.result: 4 na’th omrewgh, rag hemma a dheu drefen 5 a welas perthek, hag, kepar ha dysk, 6 ow teves an tros ynno an da yn mes.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Io veggio ben sì come già resplende 8 ne l’intelletto tuo l’etterna luce, 9 che, vista, sola e sempre amore accende;
query.error: **English:** 7 I see well how the eternal light already shines 8 in your intellect, 9 which, seen, alone and always kindles love;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 e s’altra cosa vostro amor seduce, 11 non è se non di quella alcun vestigio, 12 mal conosciuto, che quivi traluce.
query.error: **English:** 10 and if something else seduces your love, 11 it is nothing but some trace of that, 12 poorly understood, which shines through here.
query.result: 10 ha mar traow erel a wraga aga karantek, 11 nyns yw mes efan a henna, 12 marthys dhe wel, hag a skler ama.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Tu vuo’ saper se con altro servigio, 14 per manco voto, si può render tanto 15 che l’anima sicuri di letigio».
query.error: **English:** 13 You want to know if with another service, 14 for a lesser vow, one can render so much 15 that the soul is assured of no dispute.
query.result: 13 Whans yw eus karas ha gans servys erel, 14 rag mann a veu mank, gallos den gul re 15 pubma ow sygur aga eneval dhe’n stryf.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Sì cominciò Beatrice questo canto; 17 e sì com’ uom che suo parlar non spezza, 18 continüò così ’l processo santo:
query.error: **English:** 16 Thus Beatrice began this song; 17 and like one who does not break off his speech, 18 she continued the holy discourse thus:
query.result: 16 Kepar hyn Beatrice a dhallathas an kan, 17 ha kepar den na wraga y’n lavar, 18 ow kovyas an lavar sans:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Lo maggior don che Dio per sua larghezza 20 fesse creando, e a la sua bontate 21 più conformato, e quel ch’e’ più apprezza,
query.error: **English:** 19 “The greatest gift that God in his generosity 20 made in creating, and to his goodness 21 most conformed, and that which he most values,
query.result: 19 “An ro dhynnertha a roos Duw yn y voynder 20 ow kul yn kreygya, ha dhe’y vonder 21 moyha kemmyskys, ha’n traow moyha a gar,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 fu de la volontà la libertate; 23 di che le creature intelligenti, 24 e tutte e sole, fuoro e son dotate.
query.error: **English:** 22 was the freedom of the will; 23 with which intelligent creatures, 24 and they alone, were and are endowed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Or ti parrà, se tu quinci argomenti, 26 l’alto valor del voto, s’è sì fatto 27 che Dio consenta quando tu consenti;
query.error: **English:** 25 Now it will seem to you, if you reason from this, 26 the high value of the vow, if it is so made 27 that God consents when you consent;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 ché, nel fermar tra Dio e l’omo il patto, 29 vittima fassi di questo tesoro, 30 tal quale io dico; e fassi col suo atto.
query.error: **English:** 28 for, in establishing the pact between God and man, 29 one makes a victim of this treasure, 30 just as I say; and one does so with one's own act.
query.result: 28 rag, y'n gwres an kesunyans ynter Dew ha dyn, 29 an tresor ma a wra gwres a'y honan, 30 dell yw owth ow leverel; ha'n wra'th owth y'y honan ober.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Dunque che render puossi per ristoro? 32 Se credi bene usar quel c’hai offerto, 33 di maltolletto vuo’ far buon lavoro.
query.error: **English:** 31 Therefore, what can be given in compensation? 32 If you believe you are using well what you have offered, 33 you want to make good work out of bad material.
query.result: 31 Dell pyth yw gallos rag kompensasyon? 32 Gen gre'thys owth owth ow leverel yn ta, 33 owth ow leverel drok owth ow leverel da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Tu se’ omai del maggior punto certo; 35 ma perché Santa Chiesa in ciò dispensa, 36 che par contra lo ver ch’i’ t’ho scoverto,
query.error: **English:** 34 You are now certain of the most important point; 35 but because Holy Church dispenses in this, 36 which seems contrary to the truth that I have revealed to you,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 convienti ancor sedere un poco a mensa, 38 però che ’l cibo rigido c’hai preso, 39 richiede ancora aiuto a tua dispensa.
query.error: **English:** 37 you must still sit down at the table for a while, 38 because the hard food that you have taken 39 still requires help from your pantry.
query.result: 37 owth ow leverel a wra'gas dhe'sel dhe'n fordh rag termyn, 38 rag an boes kalet owth ow leverel owth ow kemeres, 39 a wra'gas dhe'sel dhe'n fordh skoedh dhe'th ow dispensa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Apri la mente a quel ch’io ti paleso 41 e fermalvi entro; ché non fa scïenza, 42 sanza lo ritenere, avere inteso.
query.error: **English:** 40 Open your mind to what I reveal to you 41 and fix it within; for without retaining it, 42 having understood is not knowledge.
query.result: 40 Digor dhe'th spyr dhe'n hyn owth ow leverel owth ow diskudhys dhe'th ow, 41 ha'gas owth ow dhe'sel dhe'nna; rag nyns yw skiens, 42 heb owth ow dhe'sel dhe'nna, dhe'n fordh komprehendya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Due cose si convegnono a l’essenza 44 di questo sacrificio: l’una è quella 45 di che si fa; l’altr’ è la convenenza.
query.error: **English:** 43 Two things are necessary for the essence 44 of this sacrifice: one is that 45 of which it is made; the other is the agreement.
query.result: 43 Dew dra a wra gesys rag essens 44 a'n sakrifis ma: an kynsa yw henna 45 a wra gwres; an nessa yw an kesunyans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Quest’ ultima già mai non si cancella 47 se non servata; e intorno di lei 48 sì preciso di sopra si favella:
query.error: **English:** 46 This latter is never cancelled 47 unless it is kept; and concerning it 48 we have spoken so precisely above:
query.result: 46 An nessa nyns yw kensys byth 47 marnas servyes; ha'gas owth ow leverel 48 kewsys yn kler yn fenowgh a-ugh:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 però necessitato fu a li Ebrei 50 pur l’offerere, ancor ch’alcuna offerta 51 sì permutasse, come saver dei.
query.error: **English:** 49 therefore the Hebrews were compelled 50 to offer it, even though some offering 51 was changed, as you will know.
query.result: 49 rag henna an Ebreon oedh gesys 50 dhe'n fordh owth ow leverel, bythow tek oedh nebes 51 owth ow leverel owth ow permutya, dell owth ow leverel a wra gowsow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 L’altra, che per materia t’è aperta, 53 puote ben esser tal, che non si falla 54 se con altra materia si converta.
query.error: **English:** 52 The other, which is open to you as regards the material, 53 can indeed be such that one does not err 54 if it is converted with another material.
query.result: 52 An nessa, henna a wra aghes dhe'th ow rag materyal, 53 a allsa bos bydel dell, na wra'gas owth ow leverel 54 gen ev a wra konvertyes gans materyal aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ma non trasmuti carco a la sua spalla 56 per suo arbitrio alcun, sanza la volta 57 e de la chiave bianca e de la gialla;
query.error: **English:** 55 But let no one, of his own accord, shift the burden to his shoulder 56 without the turning 57 of the white and the yellow key;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 e ogne permutanza credi stolta, 59 se la cosa dimessa in la sorpresa 60 come ’l quattro nel sei non è raccolta.
query.error: **English:** 58 and believe every exchange to be foolish, 59 if the thing given up in the exchange 60 is not taken up like the four in the six.
query.result: 58 ha'gas kredis pub permutans dhe'sel dhe'n fordh fol, 59 gen ev an dra dhe'sel dhe'n fordh owth ow leverel yn an surprisa 60 dell yw an peswar yn an whegh nyns yw owth ow leverel owth ow kemeres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Però qualunque cosa tanto pesa 62 per suo valor che tragga ogne bilancia, 63 sodisfar non si può con altra spesa.
query.error: **English:** 61 Therefore, whatever thing weighs so much 62 by its value that it tips every scale, 63 cannot be compensated for with any other expense.
query.result: 61 Rag henna, pub tra a wra'gas kemmys poos 62 rag y werth dhe'sel dhe'n fordh owth ow leverel owth ow droylya pub balans, 63 nyns yw gallos dhe'sel dhe'n fordh dhe'sel dhe'n fordh kompensya gans neb aral kost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 cui più si convenia dicer ‘Mal feci’, 68 che, servando, far peggio; e così stolto 69 ritrovar puoi il gran duca de’ Greci,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 onde pianse Efigènia il suo bel volto, 71 e fé pianger di sé i folli e i savi 72 ch’udir parlar di così fatto cólto.

query.result: 70 rag an keth a wilas Efigenia y hendre beel, 71 ha gul fol ha fur a wilas ragthi, 72 pan glewsons ankowtya avelsa cruel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Siate, Cristiani, a muovervi più gravi: 74 non siate come penna ad ogne vento, 75 e non crediate ch’ogne acqua vi lavi.
query.error: **English:** 73 Be more steadfast, Christians, in your actions: 74 do not be like a feather in every wind, 75 and do not believe that every water will wash you clean.
query.result: 73 Bydhus, Kristyon, moyha pysk dhe’n gwriansow: 74 na wra ges dell pluven yn pub gwyns, 75 ha na grysouch pub dowr a wra’th golhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Avete il novo e ’l vecchio Testamento, 77 e ’l pastor de la Chiesa che vi guida; 78 questo vi basti a vostro salvamento.
query.error: **English:** 76 You have the New and the Old Testament, 77 and the shepherd of the Church to guide you; 78 let this suffice for your salvation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Se mala cupidigia altro vi grida, 80 uomini siate, e non pecore matte, 81 sì che ’l Giudeo di voi tra voi non rida!
query.error: **English:** 79 If evil desire tells you otherwise, 80 be men, and not stupid sheep, 81 so that the Jew will not laugh at you among yourselves!
query.result: 79 Mar cupidigieth drog a leverowgh orth, 80 bydhus den, ha na wra deves fol, 81 marnas an Yudhew a wra na gorra orth!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Non fate com’ agnel che lascia il latte 83 de la sua madre, e semplice e lascivo 84 seco medesmo a suo piacer combatte!».
query.error: **English:** 82 Do not act like a lamb that leaves the milk 83 of its mother, and simple and wanton 84 fights with itself at its own pleasure!”
query.result: 82 Na wra gwul dell evel a wra gwell an leas 83 a’y vam, ha sempel ha fol 84 a wra’y omladh gans y bleser!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Così Beatrice a me com’ ïo scrivo; 86 poi si rivolse tutta disïante 87 a quella parte ove ’l mondo è più vivo.
query.error: **English:** 85 Thus Beatrice spoke to me, as I write; 86 then she turned, full of longing, 87 to that part where the world is most alive.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Lo suo tacere e ’l trasmutar sembiante 89 puoser silenzio al mio cupido ingegno, 90 che già nuove questioni avea davante;
query.error: **English:** 88 Her silence and her changing countenance 89 silenced my eager mind, 90 which already had new questions before it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 e sì come saetta che nel segno 92 percuote pria che sia la corda queta, 93 così corremmo nel secondo regno.
query.error: **English:** 91 and just as an arrow strikes the target 92 before the bowstring is still, 93 so we sped into the second realm.
query.result: 91 Ha dell saeth a wra’n keth mark a wra 92 yn kethwel an keth korden a wra kwiet, 93 felly ni a redhas dhe’n nessa ren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Quivi la donna mia vid’ io sì lieta, 95 come nel lume di quel ciel si mise, 96 che più lucente se ne fé ’l pianeta.
query.error: **English:** 94 There I saw my lady so joyful, 95 as she entered the light of that heaven, 96 that the planet became more radiant.
query.result: 94 Eno henna y’m gwelas va’n benen so lowen, 95 pan wrughi hi dhe’n goleudh a’n nef a-ugh, 96 neb moy moyha golow a wrug an planed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E se la stella si cambiò e rise, 98 qual mi fec’ io che pur da mia natura 99 trasmutabile son per tutte guise!
query.error: **English:** 97 And if the star changed and grew brighter, 98 what must I have been like, who by my very nature 99 am changeable in every way!
query.result: 97 Ha pan wrug an steren chanjya ha mos, 98 pyth vyth oen a wra, neb dre vyn natur 99 y’m chanjabyl yn pub fordh!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Come ’n peschiera ch’è tranquilla e pura 101 traggonsi i pesci a ciò che vien di fori 102 per modo che lo stimin lor pastura,
query.error: **English:** 100 As in a tranquil and clear fishpond 101 the fish are drawn to what comes from outside, 102 thinking it is their food,
query.result: 100 Dell peskiera a wra tawel ha kler 101 an pesk a wra’n kethwel dhe’n hansa a-ugh 102 rag an fordh ma’th ensons aga boos,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 sì vid’ io ben più di mille splendori 104 trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’udia: 105 «Ecco chi crescerà li nostri amori».
query.error: **English:** 103 so I saw well over a thousand splendours 104 approaching us, and from each one I heard: 105 “Behold, one who will increase our love”.
query.result: 103 felly y’m gwelas moy ages mil a splannder 104 ow tos dhe’n keth, ha yn pub onen a glewsons: 105 “Selma, neb a wra kreski aga karantew”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 E sì come ciascuno a noi venìa, 107 vedeasi l’ombra piena di letizia 108 nel folgór chiaro che di lei uscia.
query.error: **English:** 106 And as each one came towards us, 107 I could see the shade full of joy 108 in the bright radiance that issued from it.
query.result: 106 Ha dell pub onen a dheuth dhe’n keth, 107 y’m gwelas an sketh lenwys a lowender 108 yn an folgor kler a dheuth dhyworthi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Pensa, lettor, se quel che qui s’inizia 110 non procedesse, come tu avresti 111 di più savere angosciosa carizia;
query.error: **English:** 109 Imagine, reader, if what begins here 110 did not continue, how you would have 111 an agonizing desire to know more;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 e per te vederai come da questi 113 m’era in disio d’udir lor condizioni, 114 sì come a li occhi mi fur manifesti.
query.error: **English:** 112 and you will see for yourself how I longed 113 to hear about their state of being, 114 as they were revealed to my eyes.
query.result: 112 ha rag’as y hwra gweles dell henna 113 oen a wra’m yn karantew dhe klevs aga stat, 114 dell aga olow a wra kler dhe’m ylagas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «O bene nato a cui veder li troni 116 del trïunfo etternal concede grazia 117 prima che la milizia s’abbandoni,

query.result: 115 "O benen genys dhe dhynnerghas gras 116 dhe wul an tryumf sempiternel 117 kyns an milita a veu dhyskynnys,

query.prompt:

118 del lume che per tutto il ciel si spazia 119 noi semo accesi; e però, se disii 120 di noi chiarirti, a tuo piacer ti sazia».
query.error: **English:** 118 we are kindled by the light that spreads 119 throughout all of heaven; and therefore, if you desire 120 to be enlightened about us, satisfy yourself at your pleasure."
query.result: 118 an golon a splann a-dreus an nef 119 ny yw enkowgh; ha dre henna, pub vy 120 a vynnerghas klerheansow, dhe les."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Così da un di quelli spirti pii 122 detto mi fu; e da Beatrice: «Dì, dì 123 sicuramente, e credi come a dii».
query.error: **English:** 121 Thus one of those pious spirits 122 spoke to me; and Beatrice said: "Speak, speak 123 confidently, and believe as if to a god."
query.result: 121 Vel dh'y spyrys pius 122 ow kewsys vy; ha Bees ha leverys: "Lever, lever 123 yn sur, ha kred an keth dhe dhew."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 «Io veggio ben sì come tu t’annidi 125 nel proprio lume, e che de li occhi il traggi, 126 perch’ e’ corusca sì come tu ridi;
query.error: **English:** 124 "I see very well how you nest 125 in your own light, and that you draw it from your eyes, 126 because it sparkles as you smile;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 ma non so chi tu se’, né perché aggi, 128 anima degna, il grado de la spera 129 che si vela a’ mortai con altrui raggi».
query.error: **English:** 127 but I do not know who you are, nor why you have, 128 worthy soul, the rank of the sphere 129 that veils itself from mortals with other rays."
query.result: 127 Mes ny wodhav pyw os, nagras pyw owth, 128 eneval pius, an renk a'n sper 129 a wra'th kudhys dhe'n verow gans golonow erel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Questo diss’ io diritto a la lumera 131 che pria m’avea parlato; ond’ ella fessi 132 lucente più assai di quel ch’ell’ era.
query.error: **English:** 130 I said this directly to the light 131 that had spoken to me before; whereupon it became 132 much more radiant than it was.
query.result: 130 Me a leveris henna yn sywya 131 dhe'n golon a leveris vy kyns; ha henna 132 a dhyskiis moy splendens ages pan o syns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Sì come il sol che si cela elli stessi 134 per troppa luce, come ’l caldo ha róse 135 le temperanze d’i vapori spessi,
query.error: **English:** 133 Just as the sun conceals itself in its own light 134 because of too much brightness, as the heat has dispersed 135 the moderation of the thick vapors,
query.result: 133 Dell yw an howl a wra'th kudhys yn y golon 134 rag an reydh moy, dell an tommder a dhyskiis 135 an temperans a'n vapuryow tewl,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 per più letizia sì mi si nascose 137 dentro al suo raggio la figura santa; 138 e così chiusa chiusa mi rispuose
query.error: **English:** 136 so, for greater joy, the holy figure 137 hid itself from me within its own radiance; 138 and thus, completely hidden, it answered me
query.result: 136 rag moy lowena, henna a wra'th kudhys 137 yn y skynnans; ha vel dh'y figura sans 138 a leveris vy

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 nel modo che ’l seguente canto canta.
query.error: **English:** 139 in the manner that the following canto sings.
